title: Valentine website for Ahana & Suvo with animations and multi-theme styling

requirements.summary: Make a dedicated Valentine page for Ahana from Suvo and render it as the app’s default view while keeping the existing VoiceCompanionPage in the codebase.
acceptanceCriteria: Opening the app shows the Valentine website content (not the Isabella voice companion UI).
The existing Isabella/VoiceCompanionPage code remains in the codebase (not deleted), but it is not the default entry page.

file_operations.description: Switch the root render from VoiceCompanionPage to AhanaValentinePage so the Valentine website is the default rendered route/view. Keep VoiceCompanionPage code intact and importable (do not delete it).

Implement the main Valentine website page layout and wire in the theme selector, animation layers, and proposal flow components. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card/Button/Select/Tabs) for consistent UI building blocks; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure “Ahana & Suvo” appears together across all major Valentine page sections and states with consistent formatting.
acceptanceCriteria: All major visible sections of the Valentine website include both names together (not only one name).
No section displays only “Ahana” without also displaying “Suvo” (except where grammatically necessary, in which case both names must still appear prominently in the same section).

file_operations.description: Ensure all major sections (hero/header, love note, proposal CTA copy, theme selector labeling, repeating decorations/labels, and any footer text) show “Ahana & Suvo” together with consistent formatting.

Ensure the proposal flow copy (prompt, step labels, and success/celebration message) includes “Ahana & Suvo” together wherever names are shown. Use shadcn-ui components for step UI elements (e.g., Button/Card/Badge); verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add cute Valentine animations (floating hearts, sparkles/particles) and a celebration effect (confetti) on acceptance, all respecting prefers-reduced-motion.
acceptanceCriteria: The Valentine page visibly shows floating hearts and sparkle/particle effects when motion is allowed.
A clear celebration animation (e.g., confetti burst) triggers on an explicit positive user action (e.g., clicking “Yes”).
When the OS/browser prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, the page avoids continuous motion (hearts/particles/confetti are disabled or substantially minimized).

file_operations.description: Implement a floating hearts overlay layer for the Valentine page. Gate continuous motion behind usePrefersReducedMotion (disable or greatly reduce when true).
Implement a sparkles/particles overlay layer for the Valentine page. Gate continuous motion behind usePrefersReducedMotion (disable or greatly reduce when true).
Implement a one-shot confetti burst component to be triggered on explicit acceptance ('Yes'). Ensure it respects usePrefersReducedMotion by disabling or significantly minimizing motion when enabled.
Wire FloatingHearts and CuteParticles as decorative layers on the page, and trigger ConfettiBurst on the acceptance action (e.g., via state passed from the proposal flow).

requirements.summary: Create an interactive Valentine proposal flow with a clear “Yes” outcome, a personalized success message including both names, and at least one extra playful micro-interaction.
acceptanceCriteria: The page contains an explicit proposal CTA (e.g., “Will you be my Valentine?”) with a “Yes” action.
After clicking “Yes”, the UI transitions to a celebration/success state that includes both names together.
At least one additional interactive micro-interaction exists beyond clicking “Yes” (e.g., a reveal, step flow, or playful button behavior).

file_operations.description: Implement a step-by-step proposal reveal culminating in a prominent “Yes” action and a success state. Include at least one extra micro-interaction (e.g., playful hover reaction on the primary button, or a staged reveal with a small surprise step). Use shadcn-ui components for buttons/cards/dialog-like presentation as needed; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement an optional surprise reveal section (e.g., hidden love note/envelope reveal) that can be used as the additional micro-interaction within the Valentine page flow. Use shadcn-ui components for consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Implement a lightweight wrapper component that can host the proposal CTA and manage success/celebration state transitions (including a callback that triggers ConfettiBurst). Use shadcn-ui components for CTA styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Place the proposal flow prominently on the Valentine page, ensuring the “Yes” action transitions to a success/celebration state that includes “Ahana & Suvo”, and triggers the confetti effect.

requirements.summary: Add a theme selector to switch between four Valentine styles and apply the chosen theme consistently across the page.
acceptanceCriteria: A visible theme selector control exists on the Valentine page.
Switching themes clearly changes the overall look (palette and/or decorative treatment) while keeping content and functionality intact.
All four named themes are available and selectable.

file_operations.description: Implement a visible theme selector with four options: (1) cute pink hearts everywhere, (2) floating hearts + sparkles, (3) anime theme, (4) elegant romantic red theme. Apply the active theme via a data attribute or class on a top-level Valentine container, and conditionally adjust decorations (e.g., show/hide hearts/particles layers) per theme. Use shadcn-ui selector primitives (e.g., Tabs/Select/RadioGroup) for the control; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add theme-specific CSS variables/styles keyed off the Valentine theme attribute/class so colors/typography/decoration shift consistently across the page for all four themes, while keeping reduced-motion considerations intact.

requirements.summary: Apply a coherent Valentine design system with a cute romantic aesthetic (avoid blue/purple by default) and keep all user-facing text in English.
acceptanceCriteria: The Valentine website uses a consistent romantic design (e.g., pink/peach/red tones, soft gradients, rounded elements, cohesive typography).
No user-facing UI copy appears in a language other than English.
Design looks intentional and consistent across all sections and states (default, hover, success/celebration).

file_operations.description: Adjust the default global palette away from blue/purple and toward romantic pink/peach/red tones, and define reusable Valentine-friendly tokens (backgrounds, cards, buttons) that keep typography/spacing cohesive.

Implement the page structure (hero, note, proposal area, celebration state) using consistent spacing, rounded components, and romantic styling. Ensure all user-facing text is in English. Use shadcn-ui components for cards/buttons/typography wrappers where appropriate; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Add the generated background image asset for the Valentine website and reference it from the Valentine page UI where appropriate.
Add the generated hero illustration asset and wire it into the Valentine page hero section.
Add the generated chibi couple illustration asset and use it as a decorative element in at least one theme (e.g., cute/anime).
Add the generated envelope illustration asset and use it in the SurpriseReveal micro-interaction section.
Add the generated confetti doodle asset and use it to enhance the celebration/success presentation (static decoration in addition to the confetti burst animation).
Add the generated heart icon asset and use it as an accent element in the UI (e.g., badges/buttons) across themes.
Add the generated ring icon asset and use it as an accent element near the proposal CTA or success state.
Add the generated sparkle particles asset and use it for the sparkles/particles layer visuals.

requirements.summary: Update the HTML document title and meta description to reflect the Valentine website for Ahana & Suvo.
acceptanceCriteria: Browser tab title reflects the Valentine website and includes both names (Ahana and Suvo).
Meta description references a Valentine website experience (not Isabella/AI companion).

file_operations.description: Replace Isabella branding by updating the <title> and meta description to a Valentine website description that includes “Ahana & Suvo”.
